thread.title: Alexis Sanchez set to start first FA Cup tie this season while Mesut Ozil is also back in contention for Arsenal
thread.title_full: Alexis Sanchez set to start first FA Cup tie this season while Mesut Ozil is also back in contention for Arsenal

author: Marc Isaacs
title: Alexis Sanchez set to start first FA Cup tie this season while Mesut Ozil is also back in contention for Arsenal
text:
Sport Alexis Sanchez set to start first FA Cup tie this season while Mesut Ozil is also back in contention for Arsenal Arsene Wenger is set to name a strong line-up despite facing non-league opposition and could recall Sanchez and Ozil Share Arsene Wenger shakes hands with Gunners star Alexis Sanchez (Photo: Arsenal FC/Getty Images)   
Alexis Sanchez could be set to make his first start in the FA Cup this season while Mesut Ozil could also make a return to action when the Gunners face a huge quarter-final clash with non-league Lincoln City on Saturday. 
Despite a sickness bug affecting the Arsenal first-team, the players were all smiles in training on Friday. 
Speculation continues to surround the future of Sanchez, but despite continued reports of an alleged bust-up, the Chile star shook hands with Wenger before the final session got underway at their London Colney base. Alexis Sanchez looks set to play a big role against Lincoln (Photo: Arsenal FC/Getty Images) Sanchez takes a break during training (Photo: Arsenal FC/Getty Images) Emiliano Martinez shows off his acrobatic side (Photo: Arsenal FC/Getty Images) 
Sanchez has been a substitute in the last two games against Southampton and Sutton, but with all the pressure surrounding the north London club following their humiliating Champions League exit, the Arsenal superstar could be set for a recall to the starting line-up. 
Arsene Wenger cannot even contemplate another defeat - especially against non-league opposition and is turning to his big guns to ensure they reach the semi-final stage of the competition. 
Ozil was only named as a substitute for the embarrassing defeat against Bayern Munich after he was affected by the stomach bug sweeping around the camp, but he looked back to full health and will also be in contention to start against Lincoln. Mesut Ozil has been struggling with illness but he looks back to full health (Photo: Arsenal FC/Getty Images) Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain keeps the ball away from Sanchez (Photo: Arsenal FC/Getty Images) Shkodran Mustafi stretches ahead of the FA Cup tie (Photo: Arsenal FC/Getty Images) 
Wenger knows the importance of reaching the last four of the competition and feels his players will approach the game in the right manner despite being the strong favourites to win the tie. 
Wenger said: "I have always decided to play the team that has a good chance to qualify, and I will continue to do that of course. Alex Iwobi and his team-mates desperate to get straight back on the winning trail (Photo: Arsenal FC/Getty Images) Oxlade-Chamberlain, Walcott and Mertesacker working hard in training (Photo: Arsenal FC/Getty Images) Gabriel and Olivier Giroud in role reversal in training (Photo: Arsenal FC/Getty Images) 
"The FA Cup is the next game, and of course, when you’ve had a disappointment like we had in the last game, it’s important [to respond]. 
"We are favourites, but when you are at a big club, you are favourites 90 per cent of the time and you have to deal with that. It’s the next game and in the next game, people expect us to win, so there’s a pressure there of course." poll loading Who would you rather keep: Alexis Sanchez or Arsene Wenger? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
